success.text: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
success.author: Bo Bennett

success.text: The road to success is always under construction.
success.author: Lily Tomlin

success.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
success.author: Winston Churchill

success.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
success.author: Sam Levenson

success.text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
success.author: Thoreau

motivation.text: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
motivation.author: Anonymous

motivation.text: Great things never come from comfort zones.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.text: Dream it. Wish it. Do it.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.text: Sometimes later becomes never. Do it now.
motivation.author: Unknown

life.text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
life.author: Confucius

life.text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
life.author: Albert Einstein

life.text: Life itself is the most wonderful fairy tale.
life.author: Hans Christian Andersen

life.text: Life is short, and it is up to you to make it sweet.
life.author: Sarah Louise Delany

life.text: Difficult and meaningful will always bring more satisfaction than easy and meaningless.
life.author: Maxime Lagace

perseverance.text: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
perseverance.author: Walter Elliot

perseverance.text: Through perseverance many people win success out of what seemed destined to be certain failure.
perseverance.author: Benjamin Disraeli

perseverance.text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
perseverance.author: Nelson Mandela

courage.text: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, ‘I will try again tomorrow.’
courage.author: Mary Anne Radmacher

courage.text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear – not absence of fear.
courage.author: Mark Twain

courage.text: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
courage.author: William Faulkner
